meanings.definition: A writ or order issued by a court commanding someone to perform a specific act.
meanings.sent1: The judge issued a mandamus to the company to clean up the polluted river.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer filed a mandamus to compel the government to release the documents.
meanings.sent3: The mandamus to the lazy student to study was met with a sigh.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like a mandamus, compelling him to confess his feelings.
meanings.sent5: The mandamus from the principal made the students quickly finish their assignments.

meanings.definition: The act of issuing such a writ or order.
meanings.sent1: The mandamus by the judge surprised everyone in the courtroom.
meanings.sent2: His expertise in mandamus impressed the legal community.
meanings.sent3: The mandamus dance at the office party brought laughter to all.
meanings.sent4: The mandamus of nature to the seasons keeps the world in balance.
meanings.sent5: The mandamus of the CEO set a new standard for efficiency in the company.
